Demo versions of the software run perfectly on an older Mac OS (10.14)Given that the purpose of a demo is to test the plugin for quality, sound, bugs on your system. You’d assume that a working demo would lead you to think that the full, purchased version would also be compatible. Or at least, Logic would have you guess that.This is in fact, not the case. Though my assumption puts me slightly at fault, since the software compatibility is listed on the website.I (and I suspect most people) would assume that a working demo, indicates a working, compatible piece of software. Otherwise, WHAT’S THE POINT IN THE DEMO?! A COMPLETELY MISLEADING PIECE OF SOFTWARE IF IT DOESN'T ACTUALLY REPRESENT THE PERFORMANCE OF THE ACTUAL PLUGIN.This is really unacceptable. Misrepresentation of the product and clearly leads to enough confusion that there is a FAQ section on their own website about the issue. It’s presumably related to the serial number authorisation not working correctly.Again though, if the demo works, it is absolutely unacceptable for the purchased software to not also work.I WOULD RECOMMEND AVOIDING ANY COMPANY THAT MISREPRESENTS THEIR SOFTWARE WITH DEMOS THAT DON’T REPRESENT THE COMPATIBILITY OF FINAL PRODUCT.

Review.Titre: Generally good but annoying copy protection and convoluted 3rd party downloads
Review.Contenu: I've bought the odd plugins from W.A. Production and nabbed a few freebies. Some of them I really like, others are bread and butter and do their job just fine. Can't fault them in that regard - you get what is advertised.What I don't like is the annoying copy protection - you get a total of 3 activations. No way to free up activations on your own. That's a very short lifespan if you have more than one machine and/or semi-regularly upgrade your rig. You need to send an email asking for more activations when you've used them up. Sure, they granted me additional activations, but it's a horrid system and really needs to be revised to allow you to free up activations without being beholden to the company. It'd also reduce support overheads, which would be win-win.Trying to download Halo 2 Lite for free was a convoluted nightmare. After completing the checkout process, you get a PDF that redirects you to another site where the lite version is hidden/buried and really hard to find (which isn't just W.A. Production's fault, but they could have linked you straight to the product). It shouldn't take 10 minutes to download a freebie.So the plugins themselves are fine, but the user experience regarding downloading, authorisation etc. is not good.Edit: As to the reply, if you really care that much about your ratings, then improve the copy protection in your existing products. Until then, all the issues still exist, so I'm not going to change the rating. A pleading reply does nothing to address the frustrations that this has caused and will continue to cause. As a *paying user*, I shouldn't be the one who has to deal with the hassle of copy protection. You've got this one backwards. Also, a rating of 3/5 is hardly terrible. It means, "OK, but could do better". Do better, and you'll get a better review, that's how reviews work!

Review.Titre: Good experience but more development needed quick.
Review.Contenu: My rating is for the W.A. Production subscription plan I subscribed to.  The easiest way for me to rate this is to make a list of pros/cons and features I would have liked because there are lots of very good qualities to this product but also many average and poor.  So here goes:ProsProbably the most important feature is the quality of the samples both in terms of useable content and audio purity.Reasonable subscription rates starting from about £10 a month.A reasonable amount of free downloadable sample packs that just because they are free it doesn't mean they are of any lower quality.ConsIt is still very early days for W. A. Production's subscription plans so only a limited amount of their total sample catalogue is available as part of the subscription plan without having to pay further.No facility to view and preview samples from a particular product.  In the past we have all spent reasonable amounts of money buying sample CDs only to find that either very little is new or useable content, so a good preview is very important.Very little content outside of the EDM genre.ConclusionsThere are a number of competitors coming into this subscription service scheme, like Loopmasters and Splice to name but two so I think W. A. Productions will have to work very quick in order to not get swept away by these as these others offer previews of individual samples from products and the ability to purchase individual samples so you don't have to buy a whole sample pack just to get a couple of desired samples.With more development I think this could be a very good site, but they must be quick so as not to get left behind which would be a shame.

Review.Titre: Cheap stuff with some Premium Sound buried in the haystack
Review.Contenu: Website design: confusingProducts: Ideas are innovative and unique and stay up to date which is good but lacking enough presets.Value: Cheap products which can be good or bad if you're looking for premium quality in all their products. Kind of like Waves products. hit and missPros: Alot of good quality freebie sounds, serum patches, and the free Combear plugin (very nice plugin). Also its nice to have a company stay up to date and actually try to release new content even if its not the best. For example Omnisphere takes for ever to update new stuff and things like Trillian become outdated and imo Omnisphere is as well. Not to say WAproductions is replacing any premium suites like this but I would say WAP is EDM/Future Bass focused which is a good thing.Cons: Its easy to drop money on premium content you know that doesnt go on sale and will deliver quality sound like Serum/Omnisphere are quality purchases. These plugins are hit and miss and for regularly priced $60 plugins totally not worth it. Now for a sale of $5 probably is but until you learn more about the tool your using enough to make a Pro Upgrade Choice. I recently just reached out to them of a semi issue on my order and they didn't do anything to resolve the issue but just made sure I was aware of their policy. When a customer reaches out to a company they are not looking for policy they are looking for a reason to like the product. I see WAP is active in keeping replies to reviews which shows promise is customer satisfaction but falls short in my opinion of hitting their target market: hobbyists! So this is why they are 3 stars to me. Try their products. Their Demos are crippled making them very frustrating to try out but it might give you an idea if you like it or not. This BF I bought a ton of their plugins and have yet to find anything as useful as Combbear. Pumper 2 looks promising but wasn't on sale unfortunately. I'm rooting for this company. We need more competition and innovation and collaboration in this industry. But for as much Customer Feedback this company tries to please I'm not sure they are actually listening to their clientele. I think most businesses fall into this trap though not realizing investment is a two way street.

Review.Contenu: Your plugins are a good value. They work well, but I don't feel they offer the same quality as say Plug In Alliance plugs. They do not fit my genre always (acoustic music), and that is fine. Im glad you are in the game and your products continue to be available to to improve.

Review.Titre: Can't go wrong with W.A. Productions
Review.Contenu: W.A. Productions is a solid company that produce both industry level plugins and quality samples at competitive prices and that's without any of the great discounts that they regularly provide. The only thing that is lacking is a diversified marketplace. Including more non-generative (Mixer, channel, layouts, envelops) Presets, Templates, and Tools for instance.

The templates and or FLP's could be made for FL Studio stock plugins only, with a guided video or PDF to explain where things are and how to use it properly.I think this way, buyers like myself, can have that option as well.Yet, I am a very happy customer for what I have purchased for now. Excellent communication from customer service as well.

Good promotions and discounts, but I don’t like the fact that licenses are given for a certain number of registrations, I’m talking about software: ImPerfect, very often the computer breaks down after a year, you have to reinstall wines 3-4 times, but your support was at a high level - they helped, Soft : ImPerfect but I understand that this is not infinite, reset licenses manually, I like your store, but next time I will think before buying software here, as it is, that is, it is designed for a certain number of registrations

I wish the system requirements for the Mac were displayed a bit more prominently. I was still running Macos Mojave (10.14) and was rather perplexed that while the demo could run, i couldn't activate the license saying that i didn't have an Internet connection. Could've just stopped the user who installed it in anything less than Catalina (10.15) from proceeding further. Anyway, I eventually upgraded to Catalina and do enjoy InstaComposer immensely!

Instacomposer pluginThe only reason fo only four stars is the documentation (instructions) are somewhat minimal. The product itself is proving to be  musically useful. No problems with installation etc.To be able to use on all channels in Logic Pro direct would be better.I have roughed out about six songs since having the plugin.Michael.

Review.Titre: Good enough with minor inconsistent bugs
Review.Contenu: Well, so far, downloading the We Love FL Bundle was easy enough, although if there's any suggestion I can give to improve, it's that the "recent purchases" tab was at one point active and I couldn't pull it back, or at least it felt I wasn't given a choice to, causing a bit of a claustrophobic screen and impeding viewing some things. Just a small nitpick, could just be a bug because it worked another time and it was just once. Just thought I'd point it out.

I enjoyed the masterclass video series on FM8. It was engaging and covered all the curriculum I had anticipated. I was expecting a couple additional add-ons regarding specific genres, however that is merely my humble opinion and could be developed into an advanced masterclass at a reduced rate in the future perhaps.Very enjoyable content indeed though.

What I love:the plugins are great unique easy to use and they add value to your collection of plugins.The samples are great quality and very good selectionMany bundles include a lot different things including plugins, samples, presets for several synths, etc.What I can't stand:The example or demonstration audio that they show for each of their products, many times have this very annoying, obnoxious, and loud deep man voice saying "WHAT ABOUT MAKING YOUR SOUND BETTER" at the beginning. It somewhat deters me from their products even though they are excellent products.If they were to remove that from everywhere in their site I'd give them 5 stars.

This is an excellent generator which can output 5 tracks on separate midi channels, but it lacks an inbuilt synth. Therefore it is more complex to use on a DAW such as Ableton Live, which combines midi channels when routing midi from one track to another. The only options are to purchase and install a plugin to manage midi routing such as Blue Cat's Patchwork, or to drag and drop the midi clips generated onto the individual tracks on the DAW.It could also do with a comprehensive written manual althughthere are some good viseos on You Tube.Having said this I will reiteate it generates some really good midi output.

Review.Titre: A wide array of sounds available
Review.Contenu: A wide array of sounds available - from presets to samples to plugins, for all electronic genres (or more?) and plenty of good sales/giveaways every month. Not all of their stuff is what I'm interested in using, as it mostly caters to a "festival" vibe, but with enough digging you'll find there's a little something for everyone. Sometimes the giveaways are great and other times they are boring and just take up space. But can't complain about free, right? Their own plugins are hit or miss: some are not amazing, whereas others are so great you don't know how you did anything before them - depends on your needs I guess. Navigating the shop is confusing sometimes, but overall pretty organized. (I mainly just go for sales, anyway.) Overall, a solid good experience.

Hopefully, I'll be caught up with the install routine in a few weeks. In the meantime I'll be trying to figure out how to make these programs work. But you guys are excellent at your craft!

Review.Titre: Its an OK plugin that can help with sparking creativity
Review.Contenu: It’s an OK plugin.  it produces some good starting points but still needs to take quite a bit of work to make what is produced into something workable.The plug-in itself might take a few tries to wrap your head around it.   The user interface is well laid out but you will need to read the quick guide a few times to get comfortable with it and to understand what it’s doing.  What is offers is great to spark the idea.  In my workflow I use instacomposer to rough out some idea of melody rhythm pad bead etc. then dog drop them into my DAW as editing inside the plug-in is just too finicky. In the DAW I have better control and can play around with the sounds and notes.  If it doesn’t flesh out then I jump back into instaccomposer and try a different combo.   It’s not the most elegant or efficient but it works and we are in this to make music.
